#Text=CanadaVOTES : Liberal Andrew Lang running in Toronto — Danforth
#Text=Saturday , September 27 , 2008
#Text=On October 14 , 2008 , Canadians will be heading to the polls for the federal election .
#Text=Liberal candidate Andrew Lang
#Text=is standing for election in the riding of Toronto — Danforth .
#Text=Raised with Liberal values , Andrew attended his first Liberal rally at age 6 .
#Text=He has worked 18 elections since that introduction to the political sphere , but this is his first time as a candidate .

#Text=A University of Toronto graduate ( and player for the Varsity Blues ) , his career highlights include managing Bill Graham ' s constituency office . ( A now-retired MP , Graham 's career included serving as Minister of National Defence and Minister of Foreign Affairs , as well as interim Leader of the Liberals and Leader of the Opposition . ) He is currently with the Ontario Chiropractic Association .
#Text=Wikinews contacted Andrew , to talk about the issues facing Canadians , and what they and their party would do to address them .
#Text=Wikinews is in the process of contacting every candidate , in every riding across the country , no matter their political stripe .
#Text=All interviews are conducted over e-mail , and interviews are published unedited , allowing candidates to impart their full message to our readers , uninterrupted .
#Text=The incumbent in this riding is National Democratic Party ( NDP ) leader Jack Layton .
#Text=Other than Lang , trying for the riding are Sharon Howarth ( Green ) , and Christina Perreault ( Conservative ) .

#Text=Minor party candidates Marie Crawford ( Animal Alliance Environment Voters Party of Canada ) , Marcell Rodden ( Marxist-Leninist ) , and Bahman Yazdanfar ( Canadian Action Party ) are also running , as is independent John Richardson .

#Text=The riding has existed federally since 1979 , and has the seat has been occupied by Bob Rae ( NDP , 1979 – 1982 ) , Lynn McDonald ( NDP , 1982 – 1988 ) , Dennis Mills ( Liberal , 1988 – 2004 ) , and Layton ( NDP , 2004 to present ) .
#Text=For more information , visit the campaign 's official website , listed below .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Why are you running for political office , why at the federal level , why this party , and why in this riding ?
#Text=I was brought up in the glow of the Trudeau government , and came to believe in Canada as a country of equality , of economic prosperity , and of deep commitment to community and to the world .
#Text=The country that I see Stephen Harper trying to direct us towards takes us away from that Canada .
#Text=Only a Liberal government can replace Stephen Harper ’s Conservatives and restore the Canada that my father , Otto Lang , and my step-father , Donald Macdonald , worked so hard to build .
#Text=My wife and I live in this riding .
#Text=I care deeply about what happens to it .
#Text=And I think it ’s time for us a Toronto-Danforth Member of Parliament who puts this riding at the top of their priority list .
#Text=Previous to this campaign , have you been politically involved ?
#Text=How will you apply your previous work/volunteer/life experience to serving your constituents ?
#Text=I have been fortunate enough to spend time working in the office of Dalton McGuinty and running the constituency office for the Hon. Bill Graham in the riding of Toronto-Centre .

#Text=Working for Bill in particular inspired me to understand the powerful impact that a political representative can have on a community - and that ’s the kind of representative I hope to be for this community .
#Text=I am also proud to follow in the footsteps of my father , the Hon. Otto Lang , and my step-father , the Hon. Donald McDonald .
#Text=These are two men who put themselves before their countries time and time again , and who I hope to emulate as the Member of Parliament for Toronto-Danforth .
#Text=As you campaign around your riding , it 's likely that some issues are mentioned more often by voters , than other issues .
#Text=What would you say are the three hottest topics this election , in your riding ?
#Text=What would you and your party do to address these issues ?
#Text=The economy .
#Text=Jim Flaherty and the Conservatives have led Canada to its worst economic performance since 1991 .

#Text=Canadians need a government that is going to stick by them and work with them every day to find long-term solutions A Liberal government will invest in partnership with Canadians by cutting taxes for families , investing in the manufacturing sector and building strong , green , jobs .
#Text=The environment .
#Text=The Liberal Green Shift plan will cut income taxes , put a price on pollution , fight poverty and position Canada to be a leader in the 21st century sustainable global economy .

#Text=We will cut taxes on those things we all want more of such as income , investment and innovation , and we will shift those taxes to what we all want less of : pollution , greenhouse gas emissions and waste .
#Text=It ’s an extremely simple , and extremely powerful proposal .
#Text=Local representation .

#Text=The people of Toronto-Danforth are ready for a Member of Parliament that puts this riding at the top of their priority lists – one that lives here , and will work hard for the people of this community .
#Text=Is there any misconceptions about you , your leader , or your party and platform ?
#Text=The Conservatives have spent a lot of money and energy trying to paint a picture of Stéphane Dion that is simply not accurate .
#Text=Stéphane Dion is a man of great integrity , great strength and great vision for our country .
#Text=He ’s a man who has done great work for our country , time and time again .
#Text=I look forward to seeing him elected Prime Minister , and to working with him in the House of Commons .
#Text=There 's a more ways than ever to get your message out , from the traditional campaign fliers and lawn signs , to new media like websites , Facebook , and YouTube .
#Text=The tried-and-true routes get the message out to the masses much easier , but digital alternatives are much more measurable in how many are seeing or interacting with your campaign .
#Text=What seems to be the most effective , from your experience ?
#Text=There is simply nothing more effective than walking the streets , knocking on doors and meeting people in the riding .
#Text=No new technology can replace that , and it never will .
#Text=But we want to reach as many people as possible in as many ways as possible .
#Text=So new media certainly plays an important role .
#Text=On our campaign , we use YouTube , we use Facebook , we use the web to get out to as many people as possible .
#Text=And we use online tools to communicate with supporters , donors and volunteers on a regular basis .
